result.execSummary:
The defendant Antoine J M Tennin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Antoine J M Tennin in court.  William Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DOC agent Nicole McDade also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.   mld

Defendant Antoine J M Tennin in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Agent Nicole B.

  DOC agent also in court.
The Court ordered another review hearing to further monitor the defendant.  The Court ordered the stay on the condition time to continue until the next court date.  
Case adjourned to 02-06-15 at 1:30 p.m. for probation review hearing in Branch 04  (defendant's request)  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 02-06-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Antoine J M Tennin in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

 AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1: Defendant sentenced to serve 5 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #2), in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 14 MONTHS.  

 AS TO COUNT #2: Defendant sentenced to serve 5 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #1), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 14 MONTHS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 10 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No violent contact with victim, J.L.B. (child).  
* No corporal punishment of children.   
* Maintain employment.  
   -15 hours of Community Service 
   during period of probation. 
* No firearms; weapons (during period of probation).
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the DNA surcharge, and 
   supervision fees as determined by the Department 
   of Corrections, during period of probation 
   or CIVIL JUDGMENT.  DV surcharge does not apply.
* Restitution is set at zero.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 10-10-2014 AT 1:30 PM.
 Filed,
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit (not filed by defense counsel).   mld

The Court heard and granted the motion of the State to modify the no contact order to allow defendant non-violent contact with the child.  Defendant must not discipline the child or have any violations of the law.  mld

AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1 and COUNT #2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-21-2014 at 1:30 pm.  

The Court heard and granted the motion of the State to modify the no contact order to allow the defendant non-violent contact with the child.  No physical discipline of the child or violations of the law, per Order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Antoine J. M. Tennin in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for Abbey DeSiato for the State of Wisconsin.  
 "On states motion, Court AMENDED the sole charge to (2) two separate counts of misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s), a Class A Misdemeanor."  mld

Defendant Antoine J M Tennin in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Abbey M DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Defense counsel is currently in trial in another court.  Case adjourned for Pleah Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-23-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Defendant Antoine J M Tennin in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Abbey M DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  
 Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. All discovery turned over to defense counsel, including an offer letter, per the State.  Court ordered case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-29-2014 at 1:30 pm.  mld

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JLB (5/30/07).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Antoine J M Tennin in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Antoine J M Tennin in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FLANAGAN, Branch 4.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 4.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
